# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String; text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(text, r"(\\s+|[,\.!?]|\s+(?=(?:[^[:alnum:]]|[[:alnum:][:space:]]{2,})))")
    lines = []
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = String(word)
        else
            current_line *= " " * (text_width - length(current_line) - length(word) + 1) * word
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed bibendum, ligula sed bibendum varius, odio tellus tristique mauris, non blandit libero nisi quis nibh. Proin condimentum consequat massa. Morbi blandit, turpis sit amet rhoncus tincidunt, ante mi dapibus lectus, nec venenatis lorem velit a tellus."
println(wrap_string(text))
```
